trial_identification.studytitle: A study to compare the preference of two contrasting paracetamol formulations in the management of osteoarthritis pain
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A study to compare the preference of two contrasting paracetamol formulations in the management of osteoarthritis pain

interventions.interventions: All patients will receive both treatments. Two weeks treatment with immediate release paracetamol (1000mg four times daily - oral), and two weeks of extended release paracetamol (1330mg three times daily - oral). There is no washout period between the treatments.
interventions.comparator: Immediate release paracetamol (1000mg four times daily - oral) for 2 weeks.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Patient preference for a particular treatment in the management of osteoarthritis pain
primaryOutcome.timepoint: When patients have completed both 2 week arms of the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Patient satisfaction with treatment using a verbal rating scale.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Completed at the end of each 2 week treatment period.
At the end of the study

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Global assessment of response to treatment
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of each 2 week treatment period

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Overall experience of pain using a verbal rating scale.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of each 2 week treatment period

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Quality of sleep during the night
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of each 2 week treatment period

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Night time disturbance due to knee pain
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of each 2 week treatment period
At the end of each 2 week treatment period
At the end of each 2 week treatment period
At the end of each 2 week treatment period
At the end of each 2 week treatment period

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: At least 45 years of age, good general health, diagnosis of osteoarthritis of the knee with the pain worse in one knee, pain must be suitable for treatment with a simple analgesic
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: History of a secondard cause of osteoarthritis, medical condition that may affect the ability to rate pain, any contraindication to the use of paracetamol or ibuprofen, intra-articular steroid injection to the knees within the last 2 weeks

trial_design.sequence: The assignment of the order of study medication will be determined by a computer-generated randomisation schedule.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Paracetamol is first-line pain management for osteoarthrits and this study is designed to investigate patient preference for sustained release paracetamol given 3xdaily compared with standard paracetamol tablet given 4xdaily.
